title: Humidify

properties.name: description
properties.value:
The humidify spell will fill all empty water-carrying vessels in a player's inventory with a single cast including: buckets, fishbowls, jugs, vials, watering cans (including Gricoller's can), unwatered saplings, waterskins, bowls, and clay.
Somewhat surprisingly, it does not work on Empty cups. It yields 65 experience per cast regardless of the number of vessels filled. It can also be used to extinguish the wall of flames in the Chambers of Xeric when fighting Great Olm or to refill waterskins in the Kharidian Desert instead of needing to cut cacti.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Humidify
 This article has a money making guide: Humidifying clay.
Please add tips to the subpage, rather than the article below.
Humidify
Released 15 May 2007 (Update)
Members Yes
Level 68
Spellbook Lunar
Type Utility
Experience 65
Runes 1 3 1
Casting speed 3 ticks
Quest Dream Mentor
(plus Lunar Diplomacy)
Description Fills certain vessels with water
Animation
Sound Effect

The humidify spell will fill all empty water-carrying vessels in a player's inventory with a single cast including: buckets, fishbowls, jugs, vials, watering cans (including Gricoller's can), unwatered saplings, waterskins, bowls, and clay. Somewhat surprisingly, it does not work on Empty cups. It yields 65 experience per cast regardless of the number of vessels filled. It can also be used to extinguish the wall of flames in the Chambers of Xeric when fighting Great Olm or to refill waterskins in the Kharidian Desert instead of needing to cut cacti.

A steam battlestaff, or staff of water and tome of fire or vice versa can be used for maximum efficiency. It can be used to train Magic while making profit from some of the items below:

Input Output Profit
Bowl Bowl of water 47
Bucket Bucket of water 30
Clay Soft clay 43
Jug Jug of water 30
Vial Vial of water 1
Waterskin(0) Waterskin(4) 99

To maximise experience per hour with this spell, put a fishbowl underneath the spell (similar to High Level Alchemy) and to the "F1" and "F6" keys (or custom F-keys) to switch between spellbook and inventory. Left-click empties the fishbowl. Casting High Level Alchemy is always cheaper when alchemising profitable items while this method always results in loss. Upon hearing the sound effect, all vessels have been filled.

Saplings[edit | edit source]

Because it is time consuming and gives little to no experience, planting tree seeds in filled plant pots to grow saplings is often skipped in favour of buying the saplings directly from the Grand Exchange. This opens up an opportunity to grow saplings for profit. Like all methods involving large amounts of buying and selling, which require a relatively high capital to start, it is recommended to test the market by growing one sapling first to make sure it is profitable.

To plant the seeds in the pots, use one of them on the other with a gardening trowel in your inventory. This produces a seedling. When all the plant pots are filled with seeds, cast Humidify to water them. These watered seedlings will take approximately five minutes to turn into saplings, but this will happen even when banked. Repeating this process quickly will make around 1,700 saplings an hour.

Please note that tree seeds have a relatively low buying limit, so you may want to stock up on them beforehand, or grow several different trees at once.

Click here to refresh the prices on the table below.

Tree seed Farming level required Seed price Sapling price Profit per seed
Acorn 15 52 415 356.2
Apple tree seed 27 4 267 256.2
Willow seed 30 480 1,056 569.2
Banana tree seed 33 3 216 206.2

Papaya tree seed 57 3,758 4,563 798.2
Yew seed 60 55,652 57,489 1,830.2
Palm tree seed 68 41,173 44,099 2,919.2
Calquat tree seed 72 161 878 710.2
Magic seed 75 133,802 137,662 3,853.2
Dragonfruit tree seed 81 191,203 197,075 5,865.2

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
9 September 2021
(update)

Gricoller's Watering Can may now be filled by casting the Humidify Spell.

30 October 2014
(update | poll)

The Lunar spell Humidify will now work on saplings held in your inventory.

15 August 2013
(update | poll)

The 'Humidify' spell can now be used to soften clay.

22 February 2013
(update)

This content was included when the Old School RuneScape servers officially launched.
